title: Refactor: split up process.rs into multiple files
Fix incorrect IPv6 address parsing
body:
If you look at [how Linux formats the /proc/net/tcp6 internally](https://elixir.bootlin.com/linux/v4.19/ident/get_tcp6_sock), you can notice that the address is actually consists of four 32-bit integers and they are emitted using system endianess.

The [same applies to /proc/net/udp6](https://elixir.bootlin.com/linux/v4.19/ident/__ip6_dgram_sock_seq_show).

Unwrap each of the integer separately and cut them into [hextets](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hextet) for Ipv6Addr::new()'s pleasure.

Also bring the tests in touch with reality.

title: Add boot_time cache to improve performance
Provide TcpState.to_u8() method
body: Allows one to retrieve the original value safely.

title: UDP sockets have a state too
body:
Without the state there's no way to distinguish between UDP sockets in LISTEN and ESTABLISHED states.

One can reproduce this by starting `nc -u 127.0.0.1 1234` and examining the `netstat -anu` output.

title: Implement Process.root() method to retrieve current root directory
body: This PR also makes `Process.cwd()` and `Process.exe()` documentation more consistent.

title: Fix Stat's starttime, guest_time and cguest_time field integer types
body:
[proc(5) manual page](http://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man5/proc.5.html) lists the following data types for `/proc/[pid]/stat`:

* `%llu` for starttime, which is unsigned
* `%lu` for guest_time, which is 64-bit on [LP64](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/64-bit_computing#64-bit_data_models)
* `%ld` for cguest_time, which is signed and 64-bit on [LP64](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/64-bit_computing#64-bit_data_models)

title: Make TCP/UDP socket table readers public
body: This allows querying information about TCP/UDP sockets on systems where procfs is mounted to directories other than /proc.

title: Introduce Process::new_with_root() constructor
body: This allows querying information about processes on systems where procfs is mounted to directories other than /proc.

title: Fixes for Process::fd() to better protect against disappearing links
Add a `mode` field to `FDInfo` to capture the read/write mode of a FD
Memory examples
body: Added some examples about how to get current memory usage (since this is a common thing to do).  Also some docs needed to be clarified regarding what units the data is in.

title: Add into to fix type mismatch on i386
body:
On 32bit environment, type mismatch occurs.

```
error[E0308]: mismatched types
   --> /root/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/procfs-0.7.0/src/lib.rs:600:21
    |
600 |             x => Ok(x),
    |                     ^
    |                     |
    |                     expected i64, found i32
    |                     help: you can convert an `i32` to `i64`: `x.into()`

error[E0308]: mismatched types
   --> /root/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/procfs-0.7.0/src/lib.rs:642:21
    |
642 |             x => Ok(x),
    |                     ^
    |                     |
    |                     expected i64, found i32
    |                     help: you can convert an `i32` to `i64`: `x.into()`
```

title: Make sure we can build on rust 1.33
Remove as many panics as possible
body:
The `ProcError` error type now gains a new `InternalError` variant which
is designed to cover cases when the procfs library encounters something
unexpected and would otherwise panic.  Every instance of `InternalError`
should be considered a bug that should be reported

Closes #44

title: Fix kernel version parsing
body: Failure to parse kernel version (5.2.19_1) is reported at https://github.com/dalance/procs/issues/25.
